TOOLTIP.NAME_FILTER: Filter the name of the resource. Leave empty or use '**' to match all. 'library/**' only matches resources under 'library'. For more patterns, please refer to the user guide.
TOOLTIP.TAG_FILTER: Filter the tag/version part of the resources. Leave empty or use '**' to match all. '1.0*' only matches the tags that starts with '1.0'. For more patterns, please refer to the user guide.
TOOLTIP.LABEL_FILTER: Filter the resources according to labels.
TOOLTIP.PUSH_BASED: Push the resources from the local Harbor to the remote registry.
TOOLTIP.PULL_BASED: Pull the resources from the remote registry to the local Harbor.
TOOLTIP.DESTINATION_NAMESPACE: Specify the destination namespace. If empty, the resources will be put under the same namespace as the source.
TOOLTIP.OVERRIDE: Specify whether to override the resources at the destination if a resource with the same name exists.
TOOLTIP.EMAIL: Email should be a valid email address like name@example.com.
TOOLTIP.USER_NAME: Cannot contain special characters and maximum length should be 255 characters.
TOOLTIP.COMMENT: Length of comment should be less than 30 characters.
TOOLTIP.PASSWORD: Password should be 8-20 characters long with at least 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase and 1 number.
TOOLTIP.SIGN_UP_MAIL: Email is only used for resetting your password.
TOOLTIP.SCOPE_REQUIRED: Field is required and should be in scope format.
TOOLTIP.NUMBER_REQUIRED: Field is required and should be numbers.
TOOLTIP.PORT_REQUIRED: Field is required and should be valid port number.
TOOLTIP.CRON_REQUIRED: Field is required and should be in cron format.
TOOLTIP.REPO_TOOLTIP: Users can not do any operations to the images in this mode.
TOOLTIP.ENDPOINT_FORMAT: Endpoint must start with HTTP:// or HTTPS://.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_NAME: The name of the OIDC provider.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_ENDPOINT: The URL of an OIDC-complaint server.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_SCOPE: The scope sent to OIDC server during authentication.  It has to contain “openid”, and “offline_access”.  If you are using google, please remove “offline_access” from this field.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_VERIFYCERT: Uncheck this box if your OIDC server is hosted via self-signed certificate.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_GROUP_CLAIM: The name of Claim in the ID token whose value is the list of group names.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_GROUP_CLAIM_WARNING: It can only contain letters, numbers, underscores, and the input length is no more than 256 characters.
TOOLTIP.NEW_SECRET: The secret must longer than 8 chars with at least 1 uppercase letter, 1 lowercase letter and 1 number

RESET_PWD.CAPTION: Enter your email to reset your password

CONFIG.TITLE: Configuration
CONFIG.LABEL: Labels
CONFIG.CONFIRM_SUMMARY: Some changes have not been saved. Do you want to discard them?
CONFIG.INSECURE_TOOLTIP: Determine whether to verify the certificate of the Email server. Uncheck this box when the Email server uses a self-signed or untrusted certificate.
CONFIG.SSL_TOOLTIP: Enable SSL for email server connection

TOOLTIP.VERIFY_REMOTE_CERT: Determine whether the image replication should verify the certificate of a remote Harbor registry. Uncheck this box when the remote registry uses a self-signed or untrusted certificate.
TOOLTIP.AUTH_MODE: By default the authentication mode is database, i.e. the credentials are stored in a local database. Set it to LDAP if you want to verify a user's credential against an LDAP server.
TOOLTIP.LDAP_SEARCH_DN: A user's DN who has the permission to search the LDAP/AD server. If your LDAP/AD server does not support anonymous search, you should configure this DN and ldap_search_pwd.
TOOLTIP.LDAP_BASE_DN: The base DN from which to look up a user in LDAP/AD.
TOOLTIP.LDAP_UID: The attribute used in a search to match a user. It could be uid, cn, email, sAMAccountName or other attributes depending on your LDAP/AD.
TOOLTIP.LDAP_SCOPE: The scope to search for users.
TOOLTIP.TOKEN_EXPIRATION: The expiration time (in minutes) of a token created by the token service. Default is 30 minutes.
TOOLTIP.ROBOT_TOKEN_EXPIRATION: The expiration time (in days) of the token of the robot account, Default is 30 days. Show the number of days converted from minutes and rounds down
TOOLTIP.PRO_CREATION_RESTRICTION: The flag to define what users have permission to create projects. By default, everyone can create a project. Set to 'Admin Only' so that only an administrator can create a project.
TOOLTIP.ROOT_CERT_DOWNLOAD: Download the root certificate of registry.
TOOLTIP.SCANNING_POLICY: Set image scanning policy based on different requirements. 'None': No active policy; 'Daily At': Triggering scanning at the specified time everyday.
TOOLTIP.REPO_TOOLTIP: Users can not do any operations to the images in this mode.
TOOLTIP.WEBHOOK_TOOLTIP: Enable webhooks to receive callbacks at your designated endpoints when certain actions such as image or chart being pushed, pulled, deleted, scanned are performed
TOOLTIP.HOURLY_CRON: Run once an hour, beginning of hour. Equivalent to 0 0 * * * *.
TOOLTIP.WEEKLY_CRON: Run once a week, midnight between Sat/Sun. Equivalent to 0 0 0 * * 0.
TOOLTIP.DAILY_CRON: Run once a day, midnight. Equivalent to 0 0 0 * * *.

LDAP.LDAP_GROUP_BASE_DN_INFO: The base DN from which to look up a group in LDAP/AD.
LDAP.LDAP_GROUP_FILTER_INFO: The filter to look up an LDAP/AD group, use objectclass=groupOfNames by default.
LDAP.LDAP_GROUP_GID_INFO: The attribute used in a search to match a user, it could be uid, cn or other attributes depending on your LDAP/AD. the group in Harbor is named with this attribute by default.
LDAP.LDAP_GROUP_ADMIN_DN_INFO: Specify an LDAP group DN. All LDAP user in this group will have harbor admin privilege. Keep it blank if you do not want to.
LDAP.LDAP_GROUP_MEMBERSHIP_INFO: The attribute indicates the membership of LDAP group, default value is memberof, in some LDAP server it could be "ismemberof"
LDAP.GROUP_SCOPE_INFO: The scope to search for groups, select Subtree by default.

OIDC.OIDC_REDIREC_URL: Please make sure the Redirect URI on the OIDC provider is set to

ABOUT.COPYRIGHT: Project Harbor is an an open source trusted cloud native registry project that stores, signs, and scans content. Harbor extends the open source Docker Distribution by adding the functionalities usually required by users such as security, identity and management. Harbor supports advanced features such as user management, access control, activity monitoring, and replication between instances. Having a registry closer to the build and run environment can also improve image transfer efficiency.
ABOUT.TRADEMARK: VMware is a registered trademark or trademark of VMware, Inc. in the United States and other jurisdictions. All other marks and names mentioned herein may be trademark of their respective companies.

UNKNOWN_ERROR: Unknown errors have occurred. Please try again later.
UNAUTHORIZED_ERROR: Your session is invalid or has expired. You need to sign in to continue your action.
REPO_READ_ONLY: Harbor is set to read-only mode, Deleting repository, tag and pushing image will be disabled under read-only mode.
FORBIDDEN_ERROR: You do not have the proper privileges to perform the action.
GENERAL_ERROR: Errors have occurred when performing service call: {{param}}.
BAD_REQUEST_ERROR: We are unable to perform your action because of a bad request.
NOT_FOUND_ERROR: Your request cannot be completed because the object does not exist.
CONFLICT_ERROR: We are unable to perform your action because your submission has conflicts.
PRECONDITION_FAILED: We are unable to perform your action because of a precondition failure.
SERVER_ERROR: We are unable to perform your action because internal server errors have occurred.

SCHEDULE.NOSCHEDULE: An error occurred in Get schedule

GC.MSG_SCHEDULE_SET: Garbage Collection schedule has been set
GC.MSG_SCHEDULE_RESET: Garbage Collection schedule has been reset

RETAG.TIP_REPO: A repository name is broken up into path components. A component of a repository name must be at least one lowercase, alpha-numeric characters, optionally separated by periods, dashes or underscores. More strictly, it must match the regular expression [a-z0-9]+(?:[._-][a-z0-9]+)*.If a repository name has two or more path components, they must be separated by a forward slash ('/').The total length of a repository name, including slashes, must be less the 256 characters.
RETAG.TIP_TAG: A tag is a label applied to a Docker image in a repository. Tags are how various images in a repository are distinguished from each other.It need to match Regex: (`[\w][\w.-]{0,127}`)

CVE_WHITELIST.SYS_WHITELIST_EXPLAIN: System whitelist allows vulnerabilities in this list to be ignored when calculating the vulnerability of an image.
CVE_WHITELIST.ADD_SYS: Add CVE IDs to the system whitelist
CVE_WHITELIST.WARNING_SYS: The system CVE whitelist has expired. You can enable the whitelist by extending the expiration date.
CVE_WHITELIST.WARNING_PRO: The project CVE whitelist has expired. You can enable the whitelist by extending the expiration date.
CVE_WHITELIST.PRO_WHITELIST_EXPLAIN: Project whitelist allows vulnerabilities in this list to be ignored in this project when pushing and pulling images.
CVE_WHITELIST.PRO_OR_SYS: You can either use the default whitelist configured at the system level or click on 'Project whitelist' to create a new whitelist
CVE_WHITELIST.MERGE_INTO: Add individual CVE IDs before clicking 'COPY FROM SYSTEM' to add system whitelist as well.

TAG_RETENTION.RULE_NAME_1: the images from the last {{number}} days
TAG_RETENTION.ADD_RULE_HELP_1: Click the ADD RULE button to add a rule.
TAG_RETENTION.ADD_RULE_HELP_2: Tag retention polices run once a day.
TAG_RETENTION.ADD_SUBTITLE: Specify a tag retention rule for this project. All tag retention rules are independently calculated and each rule can be applied to a selected list of repositories.
TAG_RETENTION.BY_WHAT: By image count or number of days
TAG_RETENTION.RULE_TEMPLATE_1: the images from the last # days
TAG_RETENTION.RETENTION_RUN_EXPLAIN: Executing the retention policy can have adverse effects to the images in this project and affected image tags will be deleted. Press CANCEL and use a DRY RUN to simulate the effect of this policy. Otherwise press RUN to proceed.
TAG_RETENTION.RETENTION_RUN_ABORTED_EXPLAIN: This retention run has been aborted. Images already deleted are irreversible. You can initiate another run to continue to delete images. In order to simulate a run, you can use the “DRY RUN”.
TAG_RETENTION.RULE_NAME_6: the images pulled within the last {{number}} days
TAG_RETENTION.RULE_NAME_7: the images pushed within the last {{number}} days
TAG_RETENTION.RULE_TEMPLATE_6: the images pulled within the last # days
TAG_RETENTION.RULE_TEMPLATE_7: the images pushed within the last # days
TAG_RETENTION.SCHEDULE_WARNING: Executing retention policy results in the irreversible effect of deleting images from the Harbor project.  Please double check all policies before scheduling.

IMMUTABLE_TAG.ADD_RULE_HELP_1: Click the ADD RULE button to add a rule.
IMMUTABLE_TAG.ADD_SUBTITLE: Specify a tag immutability rule for this project.  Note: all tag immutability rules are first independently calculated and then unioned to capture the final set of immutable tags.
